author: Staff Reporter
text:
Collector T.N. Hariharan released the district’s Annual Credit Plan (ACP) for 2016-17 with an outlay of Rs.5,915.95 crore of which 66.51 per cent for agriculture, 13.37 per cent for micro, small and medium enterprises and 20.12 per cent for remaining sectors. It is 9.69 per cent more than the ACP of previous fiscal.

Releasing the plan at a bankers’ meeting here on Wednesday, he said top priority was given to agriculture and allied industries. He said Rs.3,303.24 crore had been allocated for farm credit, Rs.790.77 crore for micro, small and medium enterprises and Rs.1,190.27 crore for export credit, re-energy infrastructure and others.

As per guidelines of the RBI, new segments like export, renewable energy, social infrastructure had been included in this plan.

The Collector stated that the ACP was slightly lesser than the updated potential-linked credit plan of the National Bank for Agriculture and Rural Development (NABARD). He also advised bankers to clear pending applications on various schemes before the end of this fiscal.

Theni

Collector N. Venkatachalam launched the district’s Annual Credit Plan (ACP) for 2016-17 with an outlay of Rs.3,956.39 crore. It is 10 per cent more than the ACP of previous fiscal.

Releasing the plan at a bankers’ meeting here on the same day, he said top priority was given to agriculture and allied industries.

He said agri-sector had been allocated Rs.3,340.04 crore and the rest for non-farm sector.
title: ACPs released for Dindigul, Theni
